item.title: Write-behind caching
item.description: Write-behind is a caching strategy in which the cache layer itself connects to the backing database. This means that your applications need only ever connect to your cache layer, and the cache then reads from or updates the backing database as needed. Redis currently supports write-behind caching in Redis Enterprise Software. Here’s how these caching patterns work: Your application uses the cache for reads and writes. The cache syncs any changed data to the backing database asynchronously.
